page.title: 11STAGES IN PEAT CUTTING
page.content: {STAGES IN PEAT CUTTING} 1. {TURRING:}This is the removal of the thick layer of turf from the top of the peat. It used to be done with a large shovel called a "flachter spade" but now the turf is usually ploughed off with a tractor and a home made plough. 2.{CUTTING:} This is the hardest job as the peat is very wet and heavy. One man stands on top of the peat "bank" and cuts downwards with a special spade called a "tusk". Another man stands facing him in the bottom of the bank and throws out the peats - blocks about 50 by 30 by 10 centimetres. Each peat is thrown out on to the top of the bank and the arrangement of spaced out blocks is called "the spread".
